issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Allow Log verbosity to be set in hiveserver2 session

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
We need to print tez summary when hive.server2.logging.level >= PERFORMANCE. We introduced this parameter via HIVE-10119.
The logging param for levels is only relevant to HS2, so for hive-cli users the hive.tez.exec.print.summary still makes sense. We can check for log-level param as well, in places we are checking value of hive.tez.exec.print.summary. Ie, consider hive.tez.exec.print.summary=true if log.level >= PERFORMANCE.
fields.summary: We need to print tez summary when hive.server2.logging.level >= PERFORMANCE.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12725477 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build

[~thejas] The change made in the previous run was to just add a few more dependencies and required no code changes. I am not sure why the below line is appearing:
{code}
TestOperationLoggingAPIBase - did not produce a TEST-*.xml file
{code}
I have already marked the test as Ignore and made the class abstract, so ideally, junit testframework should just skip the test(as it does in my local setup). Is the above line expected?

Thanks
Hari
It might be ptest2 that expecting the file to be present. Try changing name to TestOperationLoggingAPITestBase.
